title: What is SimpleRay ?​
content: SimpleRay is a simple module to make raycasting easier and provide more features to raycasting.

title: About the documentation​
content: Keep in mind, this documentation is still a work in progress, information may not be complete.

title: VisualizeRay​
content: </> RaycastUtil:VisualizeRay( origin: Vector3 , position: Vector3 , time: number, color: Color3? -- Defaults to RGB(255, 0, 0) ) → BasePart  Visualizes a ray.

title: MarkPart​
content: </> RaycastUtil:MarkPart( inst: Instance , time: number, color: Color3? -- Defaults to RGB(255, 0, 0) ) → Highlight  Marks a part for a set amount of time using Highlights.

title: RaycastOptions​
content: </> type RaycastOptions = { Origin: Vector3 , Direction: Vector3 , Params: { IgnoreWater: boolean?, Blacklist: table? }?, MaxParts: number?, IgnoreCollideOffParts: boolean?, IgnoreTransparency: NumberRange? , CustomFilter: (inst: Instance ) → ()?, Visualize: boolean? } The raycast options. raycast options are used for the constructor.

title: Result​
content: </> interface Result { Distance: number Position: Vector3 Normal: Vector3 Instances: table }

title: MaxParts​
content: </> SimpleRay.MaxParts: number? The maximum amount of parts the ray can hit before sending the result.

title: IgnoreCollideOffParts​
content: </> SimpleRay.IgnoreCollideOffParts: boolean? Whether or not the ray should ignore parts with their CanCollide property set to false.

title: IgnoreTransparency​
content: </> SimpleRay.IgnoreTransparency: NumberRange?  Parts the ray touches must have their transparency between this range to be ignored.

title: CustomFilter​
content: </> SimpleRay.CustomFilter: (inst: Instance ) → ()? A function deciding whether or not a part should be ignored. If the function returns true, the part won't be ignored.

title: Visualize​
content: </> SimpleRay.Visualize: boolean? Whether or not the ray should be visible. Config.Visualize will override this parameter if set to false.

title: new​
content: </> SimpleRay.new(raycastOptions: RaycastOptions) → () This is the SimpleRay constructor.

title: GetResult​
content: </> SimpleRay:GetResult() → table Returns the SimpleRay result. Similar to RaycastResult.

title: FindInstancesWithName​
content: </> SimpleRay:FindInstancesWithName(name: string) → table Returns an array of instances with the same name.

title: Method 1: Model File (Roblox Studio)​
content: Download the rbxm model file attached to the latest release from the GitHub releases page.Insert the model into Studio into a place like ReplicatedStorage

title: Method 2: Filesystem​
content: Copy the src directory into your codebaseRename the folder to SimpleRayUse a plugin like Rojo to sync the files into a place
